Detailed Description

CSegmentate A collection of different segmentation algorithms, last updated 6/21/2001.

Works with the CStdImage class.

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.41, by ivb@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
Ivar Balslev and René Dencker Eriksen

Definition at line 35 of file segmentate.h.

Member Function Documentation

bool ipl::CSegmentate::BlobExpansion (  const CPoint2D< INT16 > &    Seed,
CImage &    Source,
CPixelGroup &    PixelGroup,
UINT8    Threshold,
CONNECTIVITY    Connected
)  [static]
 

Derives the blob belonging to the given start position (seed).

If the image is 1 b/p the pixel color at the seed position decides the color of the blob to be found. It the image is 8 b/p, the threshold parameter is used and the blob found will be either below or above threshold regarding the color of the seed position. If you want the original colors added to the found pixel groups call the method AddColors(...) found in the CPixelGroup class.

Parameters:
Seed  A starting position in the group to be extracted.
Source  The source image to derive from, Image is left unchanged.
PixelGroup  Resulting group is stored in this object, old information is destroyed.
Threshold  A simpel threshold value to seperate the blob from background in graytone images. Not used if source image is 1 b/p.
Connected  Decide if the blobs are to be eight- or fourconnected, as described in Gonzalez and Woods page 41.
Returns :
False if source image given to constructor is empty or not 1 b/p or 8 b/p.
Version:
0.40
Author:
Steen M. Madsen and Rolf Thunbo. IPL98 integration by René Dencker Eriksen (edr@mip.sdu.dk)

Definition at line 53 of file segmentate.cpp.

References ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), ipl::CPixelGroup::GetTPixelGroupPtr(), CPoint2D< T >::GetX(), CPoint2D< T >::GetY(), T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

bool ipl::CSegmentate::DeriveBlobs (  CStdImage &    Source,
CPixelGroups &    PixelGroups,
COLORTYPE    Color,
UINT8    Threshold,
CONNECTIVITY    Connected
)  [static]
 

Derive blobs from image and put results in CPixelGroups.

Old data in "PixelGroups" are destroyed. If you want the original colors added to the found pixel groups call the method AddColors(...) found in the CPixelGroups class.

Parameters:
Source  Source image to derive blobs from. Image is left unchanged.
PixelGroups  Resulting pixelgroups are stored in this object, old information is destroyed.
Color  The color to segmentate into blobs, values are HIGHCOLOR and LOWCOLOR.
Threshold  A simpel threshold value to seperate background from blobs in graytone images. not used if source image is 1 b/p.
Connected  Decide if the blobs are to be eight- or fourconnected, as described in Gonzalez and Woods page 41.
Returns :
False if source image given to constructor is empty or not 1 b/p or 8 b/p.
Version:
1.40
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk) and René Dencker Eriksen (edr@mip.sdu.dk)

Definition at line 32 of file segmentate.cpp.

References ipl::CPixelGroups::Empty(), ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), ipl::CPixelGroups::GetTPixelGroupsPtr(), and ipl::CPixelGroups::Update().

bool ipl::CSegmentate::FindAndFollowHighContour (  CStdImage &    Source,
const CPoint2D< int > &    Start,
DIRECTION    SearchDirection,
CONNECTIVITY    Connected,
CPixelGroup &    PixelGroup,
ROTATION &    RotationDirection,
COLORTYPE &    SurroundedColor
)  [static]
 

Finds the high contour in the image from given start point and search direction.

If no border is present a low color (black) border is used internally. If set by the algorithm the border is removed again before returning. Same parameters as FindAndFollowLowContour().

Version:
1.02
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)
See also:
FindAndFollowLowContour

Definition at line 88 of file segmentate.cpp.

References ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), ipl::CPixelGroup::GetTPixelGroupPtr(), CPoint2D< T >::GetX(), CPoint2D< T >::GetY(), T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

bool ipl::CSegmentate::FindAndFollowHighContourWithThreshold (  CStdImage &    Source,
const CPoint2D< int > &    Start,
int    Threshold,
DIRECTION    SearchDirection,
CONNECTIVITY    Connected,
CPixelGroup &    PixelGroup,
ROTATION &    RotationDirection,
COLORTYPE &    SurroundedColor
) 
 

Finds the high contour in the image from given start point and search direction, works as FindAndFollowHighContour() except a threshold is supplied.

If no border is present a low color (black) border is used internally. If set by the algorithm the border is removed again before returning.

Parameters:
Source  Source image, must be 1 or 8 b/p.
Start  Position to begin search from.
Threshold  Pixel values above this value is considered as HIGHCOLOR
SearchDirection  Direction to search, beginning at "Start". Must be either NORTH, EAST, SOUTH or WEST.
Connected  Connectivity may be EIGHTCONNECTED or FOURCONNECTED.
PixelGroup  Result placed in this pixel group. Old values are always destroyed.
RotationDirection  Resulting direction in which the contour was found, the pixels in PixelGroup is ordered according to this direction.
SurroundedColor  Returns the color surrounded by the found contour.
Returns :
False in these cases: If SearchDirection is not one of NORTH, EAST, SOUTH or WEST. If source image is empty, If source image is 24 b/p.
Version:
0.90
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)
See also:
FindAndFollowHighContour

Definition at line 126 of file segmentate.cpp.

References ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), ipl::CPixelGroup::GetTPixelGroupPtr(), CPoint2D< T >::GetX(), CPoint2D< T >::GetY(), T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

bool ipl::CSegmentate::FindAndFollowLowContour (  CStdImage &    Source,
const CPoint2D< int > &    Start,
DIRECTION    SearchDirection,
CONNECTIVITY    Connected,
CPixelGroup &    PixelGroup,
ROTATION &    RotationDirection,
COLORTYPE &    SurroundedColor
)  [static]
 

Finds the low contour in the image from given start point and search direction.

If no border is present a high color (white) border is used internally. If set by the algorithm the border is removed again before returning.

Parameters:
Source  Source image, if source image is 8 b/p the low color must be 0 and all other values are treated as high color. Source image is left unchanged.
Start  Position to begin search from.
SearchDirection  Direction to search, beginning at "Start". Must be either NORTH, EAST, SOUTH or WEST.
Connected  Connectivity may be EIGHTCONNECTED or FOURCONNECTED.
PixelGroup  Result placed in this pixel group. Old values are always destroyed.
RotationDirection  Resulting direction in which the contour was found, the pixels in pPixelGroup is ordered according to this direction.
SurroundedColor  Returns the color surrounded by the found contour.
Returns :
False in these cases: If SearchDirection is not one of NORTH, EAST, SOUTH or WEST. If source image is empty, If source image is 24 b/p.
Version:
1.02
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)
See also:
FindAndFollowHighContour

Definition at line 69 of file segmentate.cpp.

bool ipl::CSegmentate::FindAndFollowLowContourWithThreshold (  CStdImage &    Source,
const CPoint2D< int > &    Start,
int    Threshold,
DIRECTION    SearchDirection,
CONNECTIVITY    Connected,
CPixelGroup &    PixelGroup,
ROTATION &    RotationDirection,
COLORTYPE &    SurroundedColor
) 
 

Finds the low contour in the image from given start point and search direction, works as FindAndFollowLowContour(...) except a threshold is supplied.

If no border is present a low color (black) border is used internally. If set by the algorithm the border is removed again before returning.

Parameters:
Source  Source image, must be 1 or 8 b/p.
Start  Position to begin search from.
Threshold  Pixel values above this value is considered as HIGHCOLOR
SearchDirection  Direction to search, beginning at "Start". Must be either NORTH, EAST, SOUTH or WEST.
Connected  Connectivity may be EIGHTCONNECTED or FOURCONNECTED.
PixelGroup  Result placed in this pixel group. Old values are always destroyed.
RotationDirection  Resulting direction in which the contour was found, the pixels in PixelGroup is ordered according to this direction.
SurroundedColor  Returns the color surrounded by the found contour.
Returns :
False in these cases: If SearchDirection is not one of NORTH, EAST, SOUTH or WEST. If source image is empty, If source image is 24 b/p.
Version:
0.90
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)
See also:
